What does it mean to set `proofprotocol` to 2 when defining a new currency?

When `proofprotocol` is set to 2 when defining a new currency, it means that the proof protocol is set to PROOF_CHAINID. This means that the controller of the chain ID has the ability to mint new coins.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
How can I mint new coins of a currency I've created, if I've set `proofprotocol` to 2?

To mint new coins of a currency where `proofprotocol` is set to 2, you can use the `sendcurrency` command. The format of the command is:
```
./verus -chain=<chain_name> sendcurrency "<currency_id>@" '[{"address":"<recipient_id>","currency":"<currency_name>","mintnew":1,"amount":<amount_to_mint>]'
```
For example, to mint 10,000 new coins of "mycoin" and send them to "mike@", you would use the following command:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
